metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29402 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description: The go command may generate unexpected code at build time when using cgo. This may result in unexpected behavior when running a go program which uses cgo. This may occur when running an untrusted module which contains directories with newline characters in their names. Modules which are retrieved using the go command, i.e. via "go get", are not affected (modules retrieved using GOPATH-mode, i.e. GO111MODULE=off, may be affected).

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Packages built using golang need to be rebuilt once the vulnerability has been fixed. This CVE entry does not list packages that need rebuilding outside of the main repository or the Ubuntu variants with PPA overlays.

criterions.comment: golang-1.10 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.13: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.16: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
